customer_addr:
3046 NW 3rd Ave
3915 W. Gazelle Road
Camas, WA 98607

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection there was no written program of veterinary care by the current attending veterinarian for the facility.
The written program of veterinary care available during inspection was outdated and listed the previous attending
veterinarian. A completed written program of veterinary care ensures clear and accurate communication between the
facility and the attending veterinarian regarding care of animals. The licensee must have a current and completed
program of veterinary care available for review during inspections. Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending
veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian, the formal arrangements shall
include a written program of veterinary care.
Correct by 10 December 2024.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
During inspection, the facility representative did not have the ability to safely show the inspectors all parts of the primary
enclosures of animals and the property. Due to the large size of the property (approximately 300 acres), a minimal portion
of primary enclosure fencing was inspected and many animals on inventory were not visually observed including 4 impala,
2 Cuvier's gazelle, 4 slender-horned gazelle, 2 addax and 9 arabian oryx. If inspectors are not given the opportunity to
visually inspect an animal and its entire primary enclosure, then it is not possible to evaluate the welfare of that animal.
Each dealer shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials to inspect and photograph the facilities, property and
animals to determine compliance with the regulations and standards of the Animal Welfare Act.
Correct from this date forward of 06 December 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHLEEN GARLAND n

include a written program of veterinary care.

2.126(a)(4) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
During inspection, the facility representative did not have the ability to safely show the inspectors all parts of the primary 
enclosures of animals and the property. Due to the large size of the property (approximately 300 acres), a minimal portion

2 Cuvier's gazelle, 4 slender-horned gazelle, 2 addax and 9 arabian oryx. If inspectors are not given the opportunity to

Each dealer shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials to inspect and photograph the facilities, property and

Correct from this date forward of 06 December 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
